body: i know both are tottaly different characters but still there is no sense on his ult having that ap ratio on aoe and his ult also do more than just damage.

Veigar needs to have 1.3 times the AP that Ekko has to deal the same amount of damage to an AD champion (and lets face it, anyone who can build AD against Veigar does so). With {{item:3100}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3089}} for 416 AP on Ekko (champion spotlight recommended core), Veigar would need 540 AP to do the same damage, or basically an extra 120 AP item. If we assume Ekko can hit multiple targets, then Veigar can't match the damage output.

Personally, it feels like there's something a little off for a "skirmishing assassin" to be out bursting a burst mage, and to be doing it in an AoE too. I've never liked the idea of an "assassin" that can take on an entire team though, so maybe my concern stems from that.

The last part I can totally understand the concern. I dont really think that assassins should be able to handle a whole team. Maybe 2 v 1, but not really much more than that.

Except Veigar also has a stacking mechanic that gives him AP when he gets CS.
That's limited to CS he can get with his Q or champion kills, but it can help bridge the 120 AP gap. But how much extra AP does Veigar need to have a meaningful advantage with his burst?
Or Veigar could be using his ultimate on an AP champion and it will do about 150% of Ekko's ultimate.

If used on an AP Champion with the same amount of AP as Veigar, then Veigar's ult effectively has a 50% better AP scaling than Ekko's, but it would not be 150% of Ekko's ult, it would be 138%. And again, we're limited to a single target with Veigar, so as soon as Ekko hits two people he's dealt far more damage.
OK, then those 2 people could see Ekko's obvious indicator and dodge it that way.

That's not the point.  Veigar's ult is an offensive spell and it has no other use other than it's damage numbers.  Meanwhile, Ekko's ult is a utility and _defensive _ spell.  Why does a defensive spell have a higher AP ratio of damage than damaging offensive spells?  Much less one of the highest AP ratios.

Except Veigar has a passive to get even more AP, while Ekko can only get AP from items.

Veigar has lower scaling because when late-game comes, he has enough AP to deal more damage hands down. And *against* Ekko, even more.
